item.title: How Lodash worked itself out of a job
item.description: I really loved lodash. It brough the joy of compact functional code to JavaScript. Especially 6 years ago when I first embraced it. It was a wonderful library. Back then, there was no ES6, no Babel, and terrible browser incompatabilities ran rampant. Lodash along with jQuery were the saving light of that time. I gravitated towards using Lodash because the first language I learned was Scheme. It had functional programing at it’s core, and highly influanced how I think about code to this day.
